intro: Viguiera flava, commonly known as yellow ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils, thriving in full sun. Its yellow blooms appear in late summer to early fall, adding vibrant color to the landscape. Viguiera flava is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to support local pollinators.
